data.title: St. Pete Extra! August 2024 Edition
data.text:
Read all about it! Your monthly digest for all things St. Pete. Want to receive this news straight to your inbox? Sign up for the e-newsletter at stpete.org/StPeteExtra.

10 YEARS OF MAKING ST. PETE SHINE

SHINE Mural Festival returns for its 10th year! Join us October 11-20 for St. Pete's celebration of public art and mural artistry. This community-wide festival features iconic large-scale murals and special events, highlighting the transformative power of public art and adding to St. Pete's roster of nearly 170 murals.

Find all the details at stpeteartsalliance.org/shine-2024

UTILITY RATE CHANGES COMING DOWN THE PIPE

Utility billing rates and charges for water, wastewater, reclaimed water, stormwater, and sanitation will change on Oct. 1, 2024, upon City Council approval.

Stay updated at stpete.org/Rates

GOOD NEIGHBOR LAWN CARE 101

Make sure you're taking care of your yard responsibly! Together, we can make a positive impact this season. Skip the fertilizer during the ongoing fertilizer ban to keep our waterways clean and follow your designated watering days during the county's drought conditions.

Visit stpete.org/Fertilizer for more tips and check stpete.org/WaterRestrictions for your current watering schedule

3 CHEERS FOR VOLUNTEERS

CareFest returns this Fall! CareFest is a community outreach program that helps homeowners in need with minor home repairs, yard work, painting, and more through in-kind donations and volunteers. As a City of Compassion, St. Pete knows that once our own needs are met, we must look to the needs of others.

Find more information and ways to participate at stpete.org/CareFest

SHOW ME THE MONEY: BUDGET PUBLIC HEARINGS

You’re invited to attend upcoming milestones for the City’s Fiscal Year 2025 budget.

Public Hearing #1: City Council adopts the tentative FY25 City Budget and millage rate.

Thursday, September 12, 2024, at 6 p.m.

Public Hearing #2: City Council considers adopting the final FY25 Budget and millage rate, and approval of the Capital Improvements Plan.

Thursday, September 26, 2024, at 6 p.m.

The public hearings will occur in the City Hall Council Chambers (175 5th St. N.). They will also be broadcast live on stpete.org/TV and digital cable channels: Frontier – 20, Spectrum – 641, WOW! Cable – 15

For more information about the City budget and the budget adoption process, visit stpete.org/Budget

SANDBAGS! GET YOUR SANDBAGS!

DYK: Sandbags are available to St. Pete residents ALL YEAR LONG?! Don't wait until a storm is coming - avoid the lines and stock up early. Tell a friend!

Sandbags are available during non-emergency times Mon - Fri and the second Saturday of the month (7 a.m. - 3:30 p.m.) at the Pavement and Traffic Operations Building - 1744 9th Ave. N. During a tropical storm or hurricane warning, sandbag distribution locations and hours will change. Stay up to date at stpete.org/Sandbags

Find more hurricane preparation tips at stpete.org/Hurricane

WE'RE TAKING CITY HALL ON TOUR

We're bringing City Hall to your community! Figuratively, of course. Mayor Welch's City Hall On Tour is your opportunity to meet with Mayor Welch and members of City leadership to get your questions answered and concerns addressed. Our next tour stop will be at the USF St. Pete Campus on September 18, 5:30 - 7:30 p.m. Join us!

More info at stpete.org/CityHallOnTour

ELEVATING EQUITY

This August, we celebrate National Black Business Month! Join fellow St. Pete residents in supporting black entrepreneurs and their achievements. Visit a local Black-owned business to show your support, share your story, or celebrate the month the best way you know how.

Business Owners - Be sure to take advantage of business resources from the City:
